website_summaries.verdict: If the only thing trail enthusiasts need in a hiking gear is loads of comfort, then they can forget about everything else and get the Monroe Low right away. Fortunately, this affordable Northside product delivers more—it is also a force of nature in the aesthetics and pricing categories. That said, the issue surrounding its sole might be viewed as a downer by some. Nevertheless, the Northside Monroe Low’s excellent qualities make owning one sound like a great idea.
pros: Reviewers in droves were quite impressed with the Northside Monroe Low’s astonishingly comfortable confines
This footgear made for hikes shocked numerous purchasers with its unbelievably budget-friendly price tag
Some female hikers adored the cute design of the women’s version of this footgear
Its fantastically grippy outsole stoked several users
cons: Many consumers reported of the shoe’s sole detaching from the upper pretty early on, and they couldn’t be any more disappointed
A few wearers didn’t appreciate the measly cushioning offered by this boot’s default footbed
The Monroe Low irked less than a handful of patrons for having a restrictive toe room

customer_reviews.title: ehh Not happy with them!
customer_reviews.text: I thought i would get more life out of them. i received the shoes on April 9th this year! I just posted some pix after less than 3 months!! not worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: RLJR

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, sized right, very good shoe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality shoe, especially for $18. Looks better than the pictures. Sized correctly; uppers are actual swede and man made materials and very good quality; tongue is comfortable and lacing is good quality nylon. Insole is thin and provides little cushion, but is comfortable throughout a day's wear. I have no complaints, and would buy again. To manufacturer, I would recommend a thicker, more comfortable insole (insert) for 5 a star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Good hiking shoe for price.
customer_reviews.text: They were a little small at 1st, but after suffering & wearing them for a bit they stretched out to be just about right. Also, not much insole whatsoever! Other than that they seem to be pretty solid shoes. ESPECIALLY for the price!👌👍 My advice, get at least 1/2 or 1 size bigger than your actual shoe size, & then be prepared to buy some cheap insoles(Dr. Scholls inserts) from your local Walmart or Dollar Store to better pad your soles/bottoms of your feet!👍
customer_reviews.author: Jason E.

customer_reviews.title: Bad shoe
customer_reviews.text: Bad quality I used them 20 to 30 days and a giant hole apear.. I expect explanations from the seller
customer_reviews.author: Quentin Peysson

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a 10.5 work shoe, quality dress shoe or cowboy boot. Sneakers and most Asian made casual shoes apparently go by a different sizing system. I ordered these in 11.5 even though they were labeled "true to size". They are just a tad large but not worth returning in hopes that an 11 will fit better. Fairly comfortable after 2 weeks of wear. I would buy them again. Good shoe, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Auto Teach

customer_reviews.title: Northside low hiker
customer_reviews.text: I wear these in all kinds of weather, rain, snow, and summer heat. My last pair lasted over a year. Good ware for all they have gone through.
customer_reviews.author: wtk

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as Christmas present, gifted December 25, 2017...the soles ripped out by February 2018! Horrible quality!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Stojakovich

customer_reviews.title: A little pinchy.
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes. A bit pinchy in the toes. Takes every bit of the shoestring to tie them. Normally size 13 is a bit large for me.

customer_reviews.title: Very dissatisfied. Lasted 3 months. Truly not meant ...
customer_reviews.text: Very dissatisfied. Lasted 3 months. Truly not meant for anyone that truly walks or hikes. Started coming apart in 3 months.

customer_reviews.title: order .5 size bigger than other shoes.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Sole in right shoe ripped after 3 months, a nice big long gash. Was expecting a bit more time before they broke! Comfortable enough until then but too poor quality to recommend.

customer_reviews.text: Tongue too short. Tight fitting, hard shoe. Would not walk a mile in them.

customer_reviews.title: Good for flat feet--light on the cushion
customer_reviews.text: I have flat feet, so arch supports are not comfortable. These shoes are flat bottomed, so I like that. But, there very little cushion for old feet. Still not bad for the price.

customer_reviews.title: The shoe is heavy. It rubs against my pinky ...
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is heavy. It rubs against my pinky toe a bit, but it seems durable. Needs time to break it in.

customer_reviews.title: They fit well and are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I am really enjoying these very low-priced shoes. They fit well and are very comfortable.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good shoes for the price but make sure to get a size up.

customer_reviews.title: My second pair.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the shoes. Being waterproof was important. The first pair came in a little large but I still wore them over a year. This pair fits really well.

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe

customer_reviews.text: As expected there will be a break in period so hopefully the shoe fits better after wearing them for a while.

customer_reviews.title: These are great shoes. They are exactly as described in the ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes. They are exactly as described in the product description. They are good quality and holding up well.

customer_reviews.title: good for now
customer_reviews.text: Shocked how great of a shoe for the price....now we will see how long it will last.
customer_reviews.author: Sabina M Reeves

customer_reviews.title: He was very pleased with them
customer_reviews.text: I got these shoes for my son for Christmas. He was very pleased with them, at first. He has now been wearing them for 6 weeks and I was told today (Feb 1, 2015) that they are coming apart at the toes. I really thought they should have lasted, at least, through the winter. I am very disappointed and I just found out that the time for return or replace has expired. Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit and comfortable. Great for hiking and keeps your feet cool.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bare

customer_reviews.title: Right now they fit fairly well and are comfortable. I probably should have returned them but chose ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered an 11.5 D and I should have ordered a 12 D because the toe box area is a little more pointed and not as round as it appeared in the picture. Between using my old wood shoe stretchers and bending and flexing them it took me about 2 months to break them in. Right now they fit fairly well and are comfortable. I probably should have returned them but chose not to.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph F Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Nice an Tight
customer_reviews.text: Nice ,shoe;to narrow, haven decided to return them. If I cant have them as a good shoe for me every day I will return them I'm going to try NOW>>>>>fits like a glove ,a racing glove ;to tight...I need to return them give me a few days to Pkg the shoes Sorry George Cox Phx
customer_reviews.author: george  cox

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and style. Waiting to see how durable these are. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Davidson

customer_reviews.title: I'm not very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very happy with this purchase. I had the shoes less than a month before the sole started to come apart from the upper on one of the shoes. They were inexpensive enough that I'm more mad at myself than at them. They wouldn't be very comfortable without the cushions I use in my "serious" walking shoes, either.
customer_reviews.author: kentgeek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My son Loves these shoes, we order the same size and style year after year Update: Aug 13, 2016 shoes already developed a split down the right side :( Time to look for a new brand/style of shoes :(

customer_reviews.text: Worst shoes I ever purchased. WAAAAY too narrow. I can't wear them and have narrow feet. So sad.

customer_reviews.text: They only lasted 3 months but I wore them daily and was very tough on them. For the price it's what I expected.

customer_reviews.text: Don't buy folks.........the sole on one of the shoes started to come off after only a few weeks of normal wear.

customer_reviews.text: I needed a 10.5 wide. I bought the shoes because I was hoping they would fit. I'm sure it would have fit better had it been a wide

product_meta.title: Northside Mens Monroe Low-M Monroe Low-m
product_meta.description: The monroe low is all about casual styling. This hiker is designed for working, running around town, and getting outside without having to overthink it. A stylish combination of suede and nylon add breathability for warmer weather and a padded tongue and collar add comfort for day in day out use.
